de.nec.nle.siafu.control

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.nec.nle.siafu.control.Controller

  • public class Controller
extends Object
    This is the main class of the simulator. Upon running its main method, a new Controller is created. This, in turn starts three threads:
  • Simulation: does the actual simulation and number crunching
  • GUI: runs the user interface, if selected in the configuration file
  • CommandListener: listens for external commands on the TCP port defined in the config file

    Controller also acts as the reference point between the three threads, allowing them to share objects, such as the World or each other.

Author:
Miquel Martin

        public void stopSimulation()
        Request for the simulation to stop. note that this doesn't kill the GUI (if it is being used).

      • setDrawingCondluded

        public void setDrawingCondluded()
        Notifies the controler that the GUI has finished drawing an iteration and the simulation can continue.

      • scheduleDrawing

        public void scheduleDrawing()
        Asks the gui whether it wants to draw this iteration, and pauses until it wants to.

        If the gui is not enabled in the configuration file, or if it chooses to skip this iteration, the method only action is to notify the GUI that it just missed an iteration. Note that the GUI might choose to skip iterationStep iterations to increase the interface's speed.

      • setPaused

        public void setPaused(boolean state)
        Pauses the simulation. See isPaused() for details. If no gui is used, the simulation thread still pauses.
        Parameters:
        state - a boolean with the value true will pause the simulation, while false will resume it.

      • isPaused

        public boolean isPaused()
        Reports on the pause state of the simulation.

        When paused, time stops, and all automatic behaviour is interrupted. However, using the GUI, the user can still manipulate agents in his control, or update variables through the external command interface.

        Returns:
        true if the simulation is paused, false otherwise

      • getWorld

        public World getWorld()
        Get the world being simulated.
        Returns:
        a World object representing the world.

      • getSimulationData

        public SimulationData getSimulationData()
        Get the folder or jar file that contains all the simulation data.
        Returns:
        a File that represents the folder with the images

      • getCommandListener

        public CommandListener getCommandListener()
        Get the command listener for this simulator's run.
        Returns:
        the command listener

      • endSimulator

        public void endSimulator()
        End the simulator, that is quit. Stop the simulation, but also the GUI and anything else that's running.

      • getGUI

        public GUI getGUI()
        Get the simulator's GUI object.
        Returns:
        a GUI object for the simulator's Graphical User Interface

        Find out if the gui is being used.
        Returns:
        true if the gui is used

      • addMarker

        public void addMarker(Marker m)
               throws GUINotReadyException
        Add a Marker to the simulation GUI. If the GUI is not ready, this method performs no action a GUINotReadyException is thrown. If the GUI is not being used this method returns silently and does nothing.
        Parameters:
        m - the marker to add
        Throws:
        GUINotReadyException - if the GUI can not draw the mark at the moment.

      • unMarkAll

        public void unMarkAll()
               throws GUINotReadyException
        Remove all Markers from the simulation GUI. If the GUI is not ready, this method performs no action a GUINotReadyException is thrown. If the GUI is not being used this method returns silently and does nothing.
        Throws:
        GUINotReadyException - if the GUI can not draw the mark at the moment.

      • unMark

        public void unMark(Trackable t)
            throws GUINotReadyException
        Remove the Marker for this Trackable from the simulation GUI F. If the GUI is not ready, this method performs no action a GUINotReadyException is thrown. If the GUI is not being used this method returns silently and does nothing.
        Parameters:
        t - the Trackable to unmark
        Throws:
        GUINotReadyException - if the GUI can not draw the mark at the moment.

      • isMarked

        public boolean isMarked(Trackable t)
                 throws GUINotReadyException
        Find out if the given Trackable is marked in the GUI. If the GUI is not ready, this method throws a GUINotReadyException. If the GUI is not being used this method returns false.
        Parameters:
        t - the Trackable about which we are asking
        Returns:
        true if the trackable has been marked, false otherwise
        Throws:
        GUINotReadyException - if the GUI can not draw the mark at the moment.

      • isSimulationRunning

        public boolean isSimulationRunning()
        Find out if the simulation is finished loading and already running.
        Returns:
        true if the simulation is running.
